medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 16 years of age when bilateral thyroid nodularity developed. Fourteen years later, a mass developed in the left side of the neck. Six months post the second surgery, a mass recurred in the same area, leading to multiple surgeries over the years. At 34 years, a new echoing thyroid nodule was found again. The nodules increased in size over the years, with notable rapid growth.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of fibrocystic breast disease, bilateral thyroid nodules treated surgically at age 16, near-total thyroidectomy, completion thyroidectomy, primary ovarian failure diagnosed at 32, multiple benign breast biopsies, and skin lesion excisions.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had thyroiditis, father had colonic polyps, and sister had a small goiter at 31 years of age.
medical_history.social_history: Married, no children, works in an office, drinks alcohol in moderation, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
